a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original item is in the public domain. The text encoding and editorial notes were created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Any reuse of the material should credit the Walt Whitman Archive. Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

notesStmt.note: This may have been an early conception of the poem that was eventually titled "Crossing Brooklyn Ferry," first published as "Sun-Down Poem" in the 1856 edition of Leaves of Grass. The heading of this manuscript reads "A City Walk," which may be suggestive of the tentative title "City of Walks and Joys," the name Whitman originally assigned to "Calamus" 18 in his "Blue Book" revisions of the 1860 edition of Leaves of Grass. This title was changed in the "Blue Book" to "City of orgies, walks and joys" and finally became "City of Orgies" in the 1867 edition. This manuscript was likely written around 1855.

revisionDesc.change: added work relation info for "City of Orgies" in the 'date note' in the header
checked, added information to bibl from finding aid, added underline, added inline "v"

work.p: This brief manuscript mentions a "list of all that is seen in a walk through the streets of Brooklyn & New York,—and crossing the ferry." This may have been an early conception of the poem that was eventually titled "Crossing Brooklyn Ferry," first published as "Sun-Down Poem" in the 1856 edition of Leaves of Grass.

The heading of this manuscript reads "A City Walk," which may be suggestive of the tentative title "City of Walks and Joys," the name Whitman originally assigned to "Calamus" 18 in his "Blue Book" revisions of the 1860 edition of Leaves of Grass. This title was changed in the "Blue Book" to "City of orgies, walks and joys" and finally became "City of Orgies" in the 1867 edition.

div1.head: A City Walk:
div1.ab: Just a list of all that is seen in a walk through the streets of Brooklyn & New York,—and crossing the ferry.
